entry.title: Images Are Programs
entry.content:
Today I’ve found Piet, a programming language where the source code looks like an image.

In other words an image is executable as a program: you run the image with Piet and something happens.

Think QR codes. But instead of black dots there are colors and shapes, and, the information these images encode have some real functionality. Like …

… Anything. Probably with some development Piet can be enhanced to a level where an ordinary image can encode a full website, or web application.

Even more: you could have an avatar encoded with Piet holding all information about you. Who you are, what do you think, what you did in your entire lifetime, and what are you up to.

Now think about yourself as a 3D Piet program.

And think about Universe as a Piet program. When looking at, running it, it displays itself as we perceive today.

So everything we perceive is a program, nothing more. There is a picture in where we all live.

The existence of that picture is our existence itself.

entry.title: Times
entry.content:
There are at least two types of time: the one we all know — with past and future — and another, called present, the moment when everything is happening.

Stephen Hawking showed us the linear time is finite — started about 15bn years ago and having an end somewhere. And he also says physics — thus humans in a physical universe — have less sense in a finite spacetime.

Physics managed to solve this problem by transforming the finite spacetime to something infinite like the surface of our planet by adding a new kind of time, an imaginary one.

This imaginary time has a completely different nature and direction than the real time. It is not about the far past and the far future but the endless possibilities one has in the present.

Imaginary time moves up and down instead of back and forth. It may be your mood for a given moment. Your level of spirit at a certain time.

It is strange the path physics walked through centuries: by researching the real life and existence they’ve come to add an imaginary dimension to the rescue.

entry.title: The Canon Of Creating And Enjoying Knowledge
entry.content:
The way creation follows is an universal rule. The universe, the Greek drama, Shakespeare, all creators and you are driven by these steps. This is the canon of creating and enjoying knowledge.

First comes the hard work to conquer your fear to meet the unknown, to stop ignoring things that matter, to be able to sense the noise, to start feeding yourself with source you consider valuable.

After the fear comes the acceptance once you’ve created usable interfaces to the unknown. You’ve already identified your heroes, leaders, points to follow on the subject. Noise is filtered into signal and you’ll start learning by combination and logistics.

You’ll gain self confidence by becoming able to share. You are now part of a culture you are proud of, an accepted member of a tribe — your reasoning has finally an echo. Your format strengthens, your growth started.

Once you are able to use what you are — you become master to, intelligent to your environment. You are part of the revolution your tribe is aiming for, you are a creator in harmony with your goals and your achievements.

This is called love, evolution, progress as everyone desires, the all wanted flow, the beauty and the force of knowledge.
